Posts.Content: Hi, i had same problems with my two best friends (38 years) finally told them i had felt abandoned by them-one took it really well and was so sorry and has been in constant touch since-other one still on the fence a bit.  seems like we should have to always be in touch with them instead of the other way round.  I also had to spend 52 nights in hospital-they only visited twice each.  Hey ho - just have to get on with it-thank god for this site though - have found it so helpful knowing that others are having the same problems.  Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Second primary cancer just diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi, I gave up with the deodorant and used Huggies Pure baby wipes instead.  fragrance free & kept me lovely and fresh.  good luck.
Posts.Title: Chemo and deodorant

Posts.Content: Hi, i had a pic line in as well but did not have any problems like this with it.  Hope you get it sorted out soon.  If not you could always go for a hickman line - i had one of these as well and found it to be a godsend.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: pic line trouble

Posts.Content: Well done you :)
Posts.Title: Hair cut

Posts.Content: Having a picc line was great - no pain at all having it done - then no more problems trying to find veins - all positive - good luck :)
Posts.Title: Picc line.

Posts.Content: Hi, i was about the same time scale-have you got your wig yet?  good luck with everything :)
Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: Well done - it is nice to hear good news xx
Posts.Title: Picking up the pieces

Posts.Content: Hi, i had very curly hair before chemo - people were always accusing me of having it permed!! - i now have straight hair and am having it cut every 3 weeks at the moment as it is growing so quickly - my last chemo was last November!!!! :) Rona
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: Hitej0362, I have had my own hair cut twice now - although you wouldn't have thought there was enough there to cut!!!  Went to the shop where i got my wig for advice and told better to get it cut as it will encourage your own hair to grow more and it seems to be working :)   Good luck with everything.
Posts.Title: Hair - again

Posts.Content: Hi, i was about the same time scale-have you got your wig yet?  good luck with everything :)
Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: Hi Jane-doesn't matter what we ask on this site-nothing is ever too trivial.  If we can get help from someone else who has been there it helps enormously-all the best :)
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Hi maggie may  - Boots sell them - they are £28 - diagrams come with the magnets - hope they do you as much good as me :)  If not - not too much money wasted :) :) xx
Posts.Title: LadyCare Menopause Magnets

Posts.Content: Hi, everyone - have read quite a bit on the above subject so thought i would give it a try - well what a difference.  Having best nights sleep i have had in ages - 6hours in one go which is unheard for me at the moment.  Am not being woken up with the night sweats but when i do wake up i find i do have a hot flush but can put up with the odd one.  I am now only on Herceptin injections every 3 weeks.  I only started waring the magnets 13 days ago but so far so good - well worth the money :) Keep as fit as well as you can be :) x
Posts.Title: LadyCare Menopause Magnets

Posts.Content: Hi, i had one picc line then two hickman lines -  never heard of a goshong. Wishing you all the best xx
Posts.Title: Trouble with picc line being fitted.

Posts.Content: Hi Ed4132, nor heard of a break but do know that you can postpone it for a week if that is any help :)
Posts.Title: Herceptin break

Posts.Content: Wishing you all the best :)
Posts.Title: 1st Mammogram

Posts.Content: I am on the same route as you - was this all companies or just Nowicantravel.co.uk? Good luck for the future :)
Posts.Title: Holiday insurance Nowicantravel.co.uk

Posts.Content: Hi sr23, well done, hope everything else goes well for you :)
Posts.Title: Final chemo done.... woohoo!!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, had my first mammogram on Monday-got the results today-ALL CLEAR-still have a few herceptin injections to go but yippee :) xx was diagnosed in June last year,lumpectomy,chemo & rads!!
Posts.Title: 1st Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi, i was diagnosed on 16th June last year-seems like a lifetime ago :)  Hope you are doing ok
Posts.Title: 1st Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Lorraine1m,  i have had 10 injections so far with 6 to go.  I find that they sting like **** going in but no other problems whatsoever.  Maybe i am having some luck with this as chemo didn't agree with me at all and spent 52 nights in hospital over my four doses!!!  Good luck with everything. Two other ladies getting injections same day as me are having no side effects either :)
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: Hi, good luck with everything.  I have had my op, chemo & radiotherapy and am now on my herceptin injections.  I know it all seems very daunting - but you will be AMAZED at what you can achieve.  I only found this site recently - wish i had known about it when i was 1st diagnosed.  Any questions please feel free to ask. xx
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi, good luck with everything.  I have had my op, chemo & radiotherapy and am now on my herceptin injections.  I know it all seems very daunting - but you will be AMAZED at what you can achieve.  I only found this site recently - wish i had known about it when i was 1st diagnosed.  Any questions please feel free to ask. xx
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi, i was told i could use a roll on deodorant but NOT a spray one.  i used Huggies Pure baby wipes instead. :)
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: Hi, i had no problems just felt really tired for the rest of the day - good luck :)
Posts.Title: Herceptin - any side effects to the sub cut method ?

Posts.Content: Just sending you a big hug.  Have you been taken round the unit yet? This might help you a bit.  Sending you  my best wishes.  YOU WILL GET THERE  :) xx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: Just sending you a big hug.  Have you been taken round the unit yet? This might help you a bit.  Sending you  my best wishes.  YOU WILL GET THERE  :) xx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, hope you are all doing as well as you can.  Have been on tamoxifen for 10 days and can't believe how tired i am.  Sometimes feel like i have hit a brick wall and have to sleep, only for half an hour or so. Go to my bed at night shatttered and can't sleep.  Anyone else feel like this?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen for 10 days & shattered

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, i am on Herceptin as well but have not had this side effect.  Have you asked your team about it?  Good luck with everything xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Anastasia, I found that my hair really started to hurt me.  Could not get comfy when trying to lie down and it started to come out in clumps.  Made the hard decision to have my head shaved(they did it while i was in hospital with an infection after 2nd chemo). Best decision as no more pain but cried nearly all day!!!! That was in September and my hair is starting to grow back-not sure of a style yet-but it is growing back.  Stay strong and hope you feel better soon :)
Posts.Title: Hospital stay

Posts.Content: WELL DONE :)  great news
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Hi, I used baby wipes during radiotherapy (HUGGIES PURE) were a real help and found them to be useful n other places too !!!!!! Good luck :)
Posts.Title: well thats not gone to plan !!!!!!

Posts.Content: What an attitude to have-try and see another doctor asap-good luck :)
Posts.Title: How long dose the pain last

Posts.Content: I have just finished my radiotherapy and am struggling to sleep as well - even with sleeping tablets & antihistamines.  They told me it could take up to a month for things to get back to normal - whatever normal is these days :)  Had my op in June followed by chemo then the radiotherapy so there is light at the end of the tunnel.  Thought i was only one not sleeping :(
Posts.Title: The hideous midnight hour...

Posts.Content: Hi Bubbleblower, look on the bright side-just think what a great time you can have on your 60th next year!!!!  I was 59 on Wednesday and went out for a lovely meal with my husband and friends :)
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Hi Bubbleblower, look on the bright side-just think what a great time you can have on your 60th next year!!!!  I was 59 on Wednesday and went out for a lovely meal with my husband and friends :)
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!
